History

In 1757 Kashmir came under the control of Ahmed Shah Durrani, the
Afghan who invaded India many times.In 1819 Kashmir was annexed
by Ranjit Singh and made a part of his Sikh empire. The two Anglo-Sikh
wars fought between the Sikhs and Ranjit Singh resulted in
the complete extinction of the Sikh sovereignty in Kashmir.A succession of
Hindu dynasties ruled Kashmir until 1346, when it came under Muslim rule.
The Muslim period lasted nearly five centuries, ending when Kashmir was

Vision

Our vision for Kashmir is to restore its natural beauty and ensure peace and prosperity for its inhabitants.

Goals

Our goals include promoting tourism, preserving cultural heritage, and fostering economic development.
